intro: Isocoma oxylepis, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive inflorescence structure. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Isocoma oxylepis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils along dry slopes and in desert scrub habitats.
